item.title: Graffiti painted on private block of flats Townhall Square Crayford, 11th July
item.description:
Graffiti has been painted on the entrance area (ramp and walls) leading to private block of flats (block A) in Townhall Square Crayford DA1 4FH. This was done on Sunday 29 June 2025 and reported immediately to our managing agent, but we understand the Council can provide cleaning materials for us to clean it ourselves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1 Holly Hill, 11th July
item.description:
“Not Canden Council’s responsibility’ is the response received after placing the report below. Please can you expand on this and explain who is responsible for overseeing the poor works carried out by utility companies on the pavements in the borough of Camden if it is not Camden Council? Following works to 47 Heath Street to possibly add water connection; The kerb stone has been put back crooked and the pavement has been filled with bitumen instead of resin gravel, as every other utility company has done that have dug up this piece of pavement recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Hill, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amounts of commerical and household waste, 11th July
item.description:
This has been going on for well over a year now and the pile of commercial and household waste is piling up and started going onto the pavement. Am not sure why the residents of this multi flat property have created this absolute eyesore on their property but really needs to be sorted before rodents etc start

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eleanor Walk, Charlton Riverside, London
